title: Calculating Residuals on Exam Scores
question_text:
Joey thinks he can predict his final exam score based on his score on the last unit test. Using data from the rest of the class, he came up with the following equation:
$$\text{Final exam score} = 10 + 0.81 \times (\text{Unit test score})$$
Calculate the residual if Joey got $84\text{ points}$ on his unit test and $80\text{ points}$ on the final.
solution:
Residuals are measures of the difference between an expected value and an observed value in a relationship. This problem is calculated as follows:

Observed y=80
Predicted y=10+(0.81⋅84)=78.04

(observed)−(predicted)=80−78.04=1.96

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
